body.p:
Office of Secretary of State.
Frankfort, June 25, 1861.
To His Excellency
Abraham Llincoln
President of the United States
Washington D. C.
Dear Sir:
Sir

I have the honor hereby to accredit General S. B. Buckner, the Inspector General of the Kentucky State Guard, to communicate with you on my behalf touching subjects of importance, the nature of which he will explain

Gen Buckner is well advised and fully authorized to represent to you the condition of public sentiment in this state and to communicate the attitude assumed by the people and authorities of Kentucky. I have the honor to ask for him that confidence and consideration to which as the Agent of the Executive of this state, with plenary authority, he may be entitled.
